Mallikārāma：A pleasance in Sāvatthi belonging to QueenMallikā．

It is described as ”Samayappavādaka-Tindukācīra - （v．l．tindukākhīra）- ekasalaka．” D．i．178； M．ii．22，etc．； Sp．i．107，etc．

The Commentary （MA．ii．710； cf．DA．ii．365） says it was calledSamyappavādaka because teachers holding various views used to gather there and discourse on their doctrines．It was surrounded by tindukakhīra （timbaru） trees，hence tindukācīra （sic）； at first it possessed only one hall，but later many were erected through the good fortune ofPotthapāda - hence its epithet Ekasālāka．
